definition: lit. “Mr. Lü's Spring and Autumn (Annals)”, compendium of the philosophies of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1], compiled around 239 BC under the patronage of Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor Lü Buwei 呂不韋|吕不韦[Lu:3 Bu4 wei2]
pitchpipe, pitch standard, one of the twelve semitones in the traditional tone system
surname Lü
see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]
clan name/maiden name
surname Chun
old variant of 春[chun1]
spring (season)/gay/joyful/youthful/love/lust/life
autumn/fall/harvest time
surname Qiu
old variant of 秋[qiu1]
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]

sentences.english: "Lu Spring and Autumn Annals, " said co-, an exercise in harmony.
sentences.chinese: 《吕氏春秋》所说的合，实乃和合。

sentences.english: The second part mainly is to Lu"s Spring and Autumn Annals the cultural viewconnotation limits."
sentences.chinese: 第二部分主要是对《吕氏春秋》文化观内涵的界定。

sentences.english: The authors consider that the book of Lits Spring and Autumn Annals containsrich ideas of leadership psychology.
sentences.chinese: 该文认为《吕氏春秋》蕴涵着丰富的领导心理思想。

sentences.english: Is this "Lv-Shih Chun-Chiu" really that perfect until not a character can be change?
sentences.chinese: 《吕氏春秋》真的完美到增减一字都不行吗？

definition: miscellany of writing from the Western Han (aka Former Han)
"Strategies of the Warring States", chronicle of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC), possibly written by Su Qin 蘇秦|苏秦[Su1 Qin2]
Classic of Rites
Tales of Yanzi, book describing the life and wisdom of Yanzi 晏子 (-c 500 BC), famous statesman from Qi of the Warring States
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
Han Feizi, book of Legalist Philosophy authored by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Luxuriant Dew of the Spring and Autumn Annals, ideological tract by Han dynasty political philosopher Dong Zhongshu 董仲舒[Dong3 Zhong4 shu1]
"Mr Lü's Annals", same as 呂氏春秋|吕氏春秋[Lu:3 shi4 Chun1 qiu1]
Zuo Zhuan or Tsochuan, Mr Zuo's Annals or Mr Zuo's commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history c. 400 BC attributed to famous blind historian Zuo Qiuming 左丘明[Zuo3 Qiu1 ming2]
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
History of the Southern States Wu and Yue (traditional rivals), compiled by Han historian Zhao Ye 趙曄|赵晔[Zhao4 Ye4], 10 extant scrolls
the Rites of Zhou (in Confucianism)
Guliang Annals, commentary on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], first published during the Han Dynasty
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
